benchmark_details.name: Human Oversight in Classifying Climate Misinformation
benchmark_details.overview: This paper benchmarks the performance of LLMs, both open-source and proprietary, in the classification of false or misleading claims about climate change using expert-annotated datasets.
benchmark_details.data_type: paragraphs of text with expert annotations
similar_benchmarks: CARDS (Computer Assisted Recognition of Denial and Skepticism)

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs for the classification of climate misinformation and to highlight the necessity of human oversight in such governance tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is in English and potentially biased towards claims from climate skeptic sources.

data.source: Public expert-annotated dataset of climate misinformation claims and curated social media content.
data.size: 23,436 training examples, 2,605 validation examples, 2,904 test examples

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the performance of LLMs in classifying claims compared to expert annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1, precision, and recall indicate better accuracy in classifying false or misleading claims.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuned GPT-3.5-turbo achieved F1 score of 0.84, outperforming other models.

harm: Potential misuse in the spread of disinformation
